meanings.definition: A person who takes a position of power or importance illegally or by force.
meanings.sent1: The usurpers plotted to overthrow the king and take his throne.
meanings.sent2: The usurpers seized control of the government through deceit and violence.
meanings.sent3: The usurpers tried to sneak into the castle and claim the crown, but they got caught.
meanings.sent4: The usurpers were like shadows, silently creeping in to steal the authority.
meanings.sent5: The image of the usurpers storming the palace will forever be etched in history.

meanings.definition: A group of people who seize power or control without authority.
meanings.sent1: The kingdom was in chaos as the usurpers fought for dominance.
meanings.sent2: The usurpers formed a coalition to overthrow the rightful rulers.
meanings.sent3: The usurpers' attempt to take over the school cafeteria ended in a food fight.
meanings.sent4: The usurpers' influence spread like wildfire, engulfing the entire city.
meanings.sent5: The usurpers' rise to power was swift and ruthless, leaving many in fear.
